text: This video can not be playedSouth Korean President Moon Jae-in is in China - along with an array of K-pop stars.He's hoping to thaw relations that have been tense over Korea's move to deploy a US anti-missile defence system known as THAAD. Since then reports say concerts of major K-pop stars in China have been banned.So how have fans dealt with being deprived of their beloved artists?Video by Danny Vincent and Wang Fan, BBC Chinese.
title: A Chinese K-pop groupie in search of music
